arts.ttl: Hull City injury latest regarding Eliot Matazo, Sean McLoughlin and Steven Alzate after Cardiff City loss
arts.sum: Hull City will assess Eliot Matazo and Sean McLoughlin after they went off against Cardiff City, whilst Steven… The post Hull City injury latest regarding Eliot Matazo, Sean McLoughlin and Steven Alzate after Cardiff City loss appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Yet more injury worry for Hull City as boss explains Steven Alzate decision
arts.sum: News of the potential injury to Matazo comes straight after Louie Barry sustained a knee injury in the first half of Saturday's win at Sunderland, with the youngster set for a spell on the sidelines, though at the time of writing, both City and Aston Villa - Barry's parent club - had not officially confirmed the extent of his injury. Boss Ruben Selles admitted it didn't look good for the talented Belgian, who will have a scan once the swelling in his knee has eased somewhat in the next few hours and only then will the prognosis be fully known.

arts.ttl: 'Frustrated' Ruben Selles questions Hull City's lack of ruthless edge after Cardiff City loss
arts.sum: "I think it's the game when we start to play, we break up the pressure the first couple of times, they become a little bit lower and then we have the ball and we were not making the second movement to attack. "We talk about coming here today and trying to play our game and trying to be dynamic and trying to be aggressive and try to get a second victory in a row, try to give us a platform to grow, and we as a team we didn't, so we don't give ourselves the chance to breathe a little bit and get some points away from the relegation zone.

arts.ttl: Poor Hull City beaten as relegation fears remains after insipid Cardiff City display
arts.sum: Not a single shot on goal for a team who almost looked full of fear going forward, and they were punished early in the second half when Callum Robinson's deflected volley nestled in the back of the net to give the hosts the lead. Slater was penalised for a foul, and booked, and though the free-kick from Perry NG was turned behind by Pandur, the Tigers didn't recover, and after the hosts kept the ball alive, Robinson directed in a deflected volley.

arts.ttl: Callum Robinson effort enough as Cardiff edge much-needed victory over Hull
arts.sum: The Republic of Ireland striker broke the deadlock in the 52nd minute.

Chris Willock crossed into the box before the ball fell for Robinson in the centre, who volleyed home his 12th of the season to give the Bluebirds the lead. The Tigers’ best opportunity of the match arrived with five minutes left of the 90, as Kamara crossed in to Alfie Jones, who headed straight into the arms of Ethan Horvath from six yards out.

arts.ttl: Hull City player ratings at Cardiff City as woeful Tigers fail to deliver in huge game
arts.sum: City dominated the ball in a drab, goalless first period without ever carrying much of a threat, and in fact, their inability to have a single shot on goal summed that up. Losing Eliot Matazo early on with what looked a serious knee injury was another cruel blow.

arts.ttl: Cardiff City 1-0 Hull City: Bluebirds earn crucial win over fellow strugglers thanks to Robinson strike
arts.sum: The Bluebirds welcomed the Tigers in another big match at the bottom of the Championship table

arts.ttl: Omer Riza left 'disappointed' after dropping two points as Cardiff City star now has huge role
arts.sum: Omer Riza said he was left "disappointed" by his Cardiff City team having to settle for a point against Plymouth Argyle, but admitted it could be an important result after fighting with 10 men for the best part of 50 minutes. Given Cardiff were taking on fellow relegation candidates Plymouth, the bigger picture means Saturday's hosts gain no ground on City - with Riza's side having a game in hand.

arts.ttl: Cardiff City v Hull City LIVE: Kick-off time, TV channel and team news
arts.sum: The Bluebirds welcome the Tigers in another big match at the bottom of the Championship table
